result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Erik McDonald

Prior: Plover, WI

3:32 PM Defendant Erik McDonald in court, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Erik McDonald.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF380 and 22CM247.
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CM247 - Guilty

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 22CF380 is dismissed and read in.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Motion hearing on October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 15, 2022 at 08:00 am.

10:51 AM Attorney William George Weiland in court for Erik McDonald.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Jambois calls cases 22CF332 and 22CF380 and states the appearances. 

Atty Jambois does no believe this should be set for a speedy trial for reasons stated on record.
Atty Weiland states it was his client's request for this to be done in 90 days. 

Atty Jambois will be filing a motion to join and possibly other axe evidence.
Substantive motions to be heard at the motion hearing.

Substantive motions to be filed by October 5th.
Discovery is done and exchanged and parties to let court know by October 5th. 
Motions in limine, jury instructions, and witness lists to be filed by October 20th. 

Branch 3 Office to produce scheduling order for both cases. 

State is in compliance with victim rights legislation.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint
Request for Speedy Trial Demand filed by Atty William Weiland (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 09/13/22 sp)
Scheduling conference on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Atty Weiland will be filing a speedy trial demand.
Parties are to go to Br 3 to get a hearing date/time.

3:48 PM Defendant Erik McDonald in court, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Erik McDonald.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews the files to make sure that he is able to hear both of these cases today.
Court makes statements on the record.
Atty Weiland discusses the statements of the Court with his client.
Parties are ready to proceed.

3:36 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, is marked for ADA Jambois.
Officer C O'Neil is sworn in. 
Direct examination by ADA Jambois.
3:49 p.m.  ADA Jambois references exhibit #P1.
3:50 p.m.  ADA Jambois would ask that exhibit #P1 be offered into evidence, subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Weiland.  Received by the Court.
3:50 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record will reflect that the witness has identified by defendant.
3:50 p.m.  Atty Weiland has no cross examination.
ADA Jambois has no additional redirect, witnesses or final argument.
Witness is excused.
Atty Weiland has no witnesses or final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:29 PM Defendant Erik McDonald appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Erik McDonald.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF332 and 22CF380.

ADA Pfeil calls the cases and states the appearances.
Atty Weiland has not yet been appointed on the 22CF380.
Atty Weiland questions the charges and Court informs him of these charges.
BY THE COURT: 
Defendant is informed to contact the Public Defender and have Atty Weiland appointed to his new case.

ADA Pfeil provides both complaints to Atty Weiland.
Defendant has not gotten the complaint in 22CF380.
Defendant makes statements.
Atty Weiland is asking that the parties move to the Initial Appearances on both cases as he does not doubt that he will be appointed on 22CF380.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint in 22CF332.
Complaint not received in 22CF380.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties on 22CF380.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint in 22CF332.
Atty Weiland will go over the complaints with his client.
Atty Weiland does not waive time limits.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond for 22CF380 with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued in 22CF332
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
